&% université Well-Posedness

CentraleSupélec | PARIS-SACLAY

Definition
Let E and F be two spaces. Let f € F bea dataand A: E — F. Weare
looking for solutions u € E to A(u) = f (the PDE).

The PDE is well-posed in the sense of Hadamard if:
P asolution u exists,
P the solution u is unique,

> uchanges “continuously” with respect tof.

A PDE that is not well-posed is said to be ill-posed
